page.title: 14THE VILLAGES
page.content: {ASKRIGG,}like the other villages of the area, mainly serves the farming community, although the forest market that once flourished there no longer takes place. The tourist industry is now important and Askrigg's fame has been enhanced by being known as the village in which the Vet's house appears in the BBC's "All Creatures Great and Small". { {BAINBRIDGE }was established as a forester's village (under the Roman fort of{VIROSIDUM}) as part of the administration of the old forest of Wensleydale. Each evening at 9pm from 27th September to Shrovetide, a horn is blown three times over the village green, a practice started in order to guide travellers through the forest. The present Hornblower is 12 year old Alistair Metcalfe. The Metcalfes have been the hornblowers for 300 years.
